result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. Streich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric L. Streich is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric L. Streich was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 BOND APPLIED LEAVING BALANCE DUE OF $192.00

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L. Streich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric L. Streich in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states the agreement.  Atty Johnson agrees.  

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
bond to be applied
Balance to be paid within 60 days
Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Eric L. Streich in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession 961.41(3g)(e).  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee also states that the parties are requesting a sentencing date out 6 months and explains the conditions of that 6 months.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court amends Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession 961.41(3g)(e)

Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended Ct. 1.    Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 Misd. Possession 961.41(3g)(e). Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Within the 6 months, the defendant is to comply with the following:
- Defendant will have monthly UA's with a copy of the results given to the DA's office
- Complete 40 hours of community service with written proof given to the DA's office
Set for sentencing.
bond will be continued until the sentencing date  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson states that the parties were planning on going through with this today and is not sure why his client is not here.  Atty Johnson asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 13, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that we were last in court in June and this date was set; Atty Hendee has met with Atty Johnson on the matter.  Atty Johnson asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Prelim has not been waived yet.
Set for Plea/Sentencing.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
ACCEPTANCE OF SERVICE BY ATTY JOHNSON
Status conference on August 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.

from Atty Johnson; defendant waives time limits for Prelim and requests Status.  Ok'd by Judge.
Cancelled Prelim per request.
PETITION FOR LEAVE TO FILE ADDITIONAL MOTIONS
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2014 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Eric L. Streich in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he provided the defendant with an amended complaint today.
  Defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court questions the defendant regarding the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant wants to get counsel but needs more time.  Defendant does not waive time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits were not waived.  Set for Preliminary Hearing.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric L. Streich in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond. Court questions the defendant.  Defendant requests a $500 signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond; no conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
